casebody.data:
STATE of Missouri, Respondent,
v.
Charles HART, Appellant. No. ED 105680 Missouri Court of Appeals, Eastern District, DIVISION ONE. FILED: December 11, 2018
Motion for Rehearing and/or Transfer to Supreme Court Denied January 14, 2019 FOR APPELLANT: Jessica M. Hathaway, 120 S. Central Ave., Suite 130, St. Louis, Missouri 63105. For Respondent: JOSHUA D. HAWLEY, Karen L. Kramer, P.O. Box 899, Jefferson City, MO 65102. Before Roy L. Richter, P.J., Robert M. Clayton III, J., and Angela T. Quigless, J.

ORDER

PER CURIAM

Charles Hart ("Appellant") appeals from his conviction, following a jury trial, of endangering the welfare of a child in the first degree, in violation of Section 568.045 RSMo. Appellant was sentenced as a prior and persistent felony offender to a term of 8 years of imprisonment in the Missouri Department of Corrections.

We have reviewed the briefs of the parties and the record on appeal and find no error of law. No jurisprudential purpose would be served by a written opinion. However, the parties have been furnished with a memorandum for their information only, setting forth the facts and reasons for this order.

The judgment is affirmed pursuant to Rule 30.25(b).
